item.title: SHOW 126 - *DISASTER SPECIAL* Martin Angus and Salma Shah (Election Special #14)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 126 - *DISASTER SPECIAL* Martin Angus and Salma Shah (Election Special #14)
item.itunes:subtitle: *Disaster Special* WARNING: You are about to h…
item.description:
*Disaster Special* WARNING: You are about to hear stories that will blow your mind. Find out what it's like when everything goes wrong on the campaign trail from two people who've seen disaster unfolding before their eyes. Martin Angus was Head of the Deputy Prime Minister's Tour and was in the melee when John Prescott punched a voter. Salma Shah was Special Adviser to Sajid Javid and was powerless to intervene when an event turned into a catastrophe. This doesn't do justice to what you're about to hear. Brace yourself... Follow Martin on Twitter: @martinangus Follow Salma on Twitter: @Ommasalma See Martin in action: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8UhME8dcOqc&t=21s Email your funny campaign stories to politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com

item.itunes:subtitle: Matt visits Perth to meet with former rock star P…
item.description:
Matt visits Perth to meet with former rock star Pete Wishart, who's been an SNP MP since 2001. The seat is one of the most marginal in the UK and a top target for the Tories. Pete tells us what it's like to fight in a close campaign, the transition from rock star to politician, his changing use of social media and, of course, Scottish independence. Follow Pete on Twitter: @PeteWishart Follow MP4 on Twitter: @MP4rockband Watch Runrig perform 'Loch Lomond' live at Loch Lomond (and spot Pete on keys) here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6nZ2zaW0bPg Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde To occasionally receive an email you'll probably delete before reading about The Political Party and other such stuff that Matt's up to, sign up to his mailing list here: http://mattforde.com/mailing-list

item.description:

item.itunes:title: SHOW 121 - Ian Murray (Election Special #9)

Ian Murray has held Edinburgh South for Labour since 2010. In 2015 he was the only Labour MP left in Scotland. He tells Matt about the changing nature of Scottish politics, the difficulties Labour face in this election, his personal battle to remain as Labour’s candidate and why the red jackets he wears out campaigning have confused some constituents... item.title: SHOW 118 - Luciana Berger (Election Special #6)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 118 - Luciana Berger (Election Special #6)
item.itunes:subtitle: Enfield Southgate in 1997. Morley and Outwood in …
item.description:
Enfield Southgate in 1997. Morley and Outwood in 2015. Finchley and Golders Green in 2019? Luciana Berger is looking to cause a major political upset in the Conservative-held seat of Finchley and Golders Green in what could become one of the defining moments of the 2019 election. In this fascinating interview Luciana explains her decision to leave the Labour Party as well as the nature and scale of the abuse she received. She also discusses the Lib Dem policy of revoking Article 50 as well as the specific political challenge in her constituency. Follow Luciana on Twitter: @lucianaberger Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde Email your funny campaigning stories to politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com Sign up to the mailing list for www.mattforde.com/mailing-list

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.itunes:title: SHOW 117 - Bim Afolami (Election Special #5)
item.itunes:subtitle: Bim Afolami is a rising Conservative star and has…
item.description:
Bim Afolami is a rising Conservative star and has only been an MP since 2017. As a One Nation Conservative who's passionate about climate change, is he happy with the direction and leadership of his party? Can the Conservatives bring the whole UK together in the wake of Brexit? What effect are the politics of London having on the rest of the country? Bim also reveals what his style of football does or doesn't say about his politics. item.title: SHOW 115 - Greg Cook (Election Special #3)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 115 - Greg Cook (Election Special #3)
item.itunes:subtitle: Greg Cook was Labour's Head of Political Strategy…
item.description:
Greg Cook was Labour's Head of Political Strategy and the party's polling guru. Known to Labour Party staff as 'Mystic Greg', his insights and expertise have helped shape numerous Labour election campaigns. In this fascinating interview he analyses this campaign. How is each party trying to plot a course to victory? Can either of the two major parties win an outright majority? Are the rules of politics changing? Are there any? Follow Greg on Twitter: @GregCook10 Follow Matt: @mattforde Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com Sign up to the mailing list: www.mattforde.com/mailing-list

item.title: SHOW 114 - Jo Tanner (Election Special #2)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 114 - Jo Tanner (Election Special #2)
item.itunes:subtitle: Boris Johnson's former adviser and Chief Exec of …
item.description:
Boris Johnson's former adviser and Chief Exec of iNHouse Communications, Jo Tanner, shares her assessment of the Prime Minister. Jo worked closely with Johnson on his 2008 Mayoral campaign with her colleague Katie Perrior. Johnson said of them “They are the Fortnum and Mason of Communications. They deliver, and they deliver quality. Without them, I simply would not have been made Mayor.” As well as insights into his personality, working style and character, Jo also tells us what advice she'd give to other political leaders... Follow Jo on Twitter: @StraightTie Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde Sign up to the mailing list for advance information about guests, tour shows and other partially cool stuff: https://www.mattforde.com/mailing-list Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com

item.itunes:title: SHOW 112 - Jo Swinson (LIVE)
item.itunes:subtitle: Jo Swinson is the Leader of the Liberal Democrats…
item.description:
Jo Swinson is the Leader of the Liberal Democrats and is hoping to become the UK's next Prime Minister. She talks to Matt at the start of the 2019 General Election campaign and explains why the Lib Dems policy of revoking Article 50, why the party wouldn't enter into a coalition with Jeremy Corbyn or Boris Johnson and gives the inside story on how she was almost a lad's mag pin-up. item.title: SHOW 111 - Kate Andrews
item.itunes:title: SHOW 111 - Kate Andrews
item.itunes:subtitle: Kate Andrews is Associate Director of the Institu…
item.description:
Kate Andrews is Associate Director of the Institute of Economic Affairs and at just 29 is already an experienced and assured pundit on TV and radio, regularly advocating the power of free markets. In a fascinating discussion about what openness and freedom mean, Kate speaks passionately in favour of immigration as well as public sector reform. It's a timely reminder than politics is exciting when it's about ideas and more enjoyable when discussed respectfully. You can follow Kate on Twitter here: @KateAndrs You can follow the IEA on Twitter here: @iealondon Find out about the work of the IEA, including recent research projects here: https://iea.org.uk/ Follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com For tickets to The Political Party and all of Matt's gigs go to www.mattforde.com/live

item.title: SHOW 110 - Krishnan Guru-Murthy
item.itunes:title: SHOW 110 - Krishnan Guru-Murthy
item.itunes:subtitle: The star of Newsround, Channel 4 News and Shaun o…
item.description:
The star of Newsround, Channel 4 News and Shaun of the Dead gives his fascinating insights into holding politicians to account. From his first presenting job before he was at university, to hosting 'Britain's Next Prime Minister', Krishnan takes us inside the life of a modern news presenter: the challenges, the culture and the tactics that some politicians use to evade scrutiny. It's a riveting listen and a timely reminder of the importance of rigorous and impartial news reporting. The big question is, will he tell us what his favourite biscuit is? You can follow Krishnan on Twitter here: @krishnangm You can follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com Get tickets to 'Brexit, Pursued by a Bear' and The Political Party here: www.mattforde.com/live

item.title: SHOW 109 - Ken Clarke (LIVE)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 109 - Ken Clarke (LIVE)
item.itunes:subtitle: Ken Clarke is the Father of the House and one of …
item.description:
Ken Clarke is the Father of the House and one of the longest serving Cabinet ministers in British history. A prominent Chancellor, Health Secretary and Home Secretary among many other positions, he is one of the most popular politicians in Parliament. He now finds himself in an unusual position, having the Conservative Whip removed for blocking a 'No Deal' Brexit. He joins Matt on the evening that Boris Johnson addressed the Commons following the Supreme Court ruling that found he'd acted unlawfully in proroguing Parliament (and explains why he wasn't there to witness it). As well as giving us his hilarious and frank assessment of the state we're in, Ken gives us the inside story on some of the biggest moments in recent history including The Poll Tax and The Miner's Strike. By the time you listen to this, who knows what role Ken may have..? You can email the show here: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com You can buy tickets to see 'Brexit Pursued by a Bear' at The Southbank Centre on 6 October: https://www.southbankcentre.co.uk/whats-on/138649-matt-forde-brexit-pursued-bear-2019 You can buy tickets to see 'Brexit Pursued by a Bear' at Kings Place on 12 October: https://www.kingsplace.co.uk/whats-on/comedy/matt-forde-brexit-pursued-by-a-bear/ You can buy tickets to The Political Party Christmas Special here: https://www.ucl.ac.uk/culture/whats-on/matt-fordes-political-party-podcast-christmas-special

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: SHOW 108 - Darren Grimes
item.itunes:title: SHOW 108 - Darren Grimes
item.itunes:subtitle: Darren Grimes is a Eurosceptic campaigner who tel…
item.description:
Darren Grimes is a Eurosceptic campaigner who tells Matt the harrowing inside story of how he came to be fined £20,000 by the Electoral Commission and how he had the verdict overturned on appeal. In one of the most fascinating episodes of The Political Party, Darren explains his journey from the Lib Dems to the Conservatives and the story of his rise to prominence so early in his 20s. Follow Darren on Twitter here: @darrengrimes_ Follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde Get tickets for the London performances of 'Brexit, Pursued by a Bear' here: www.mattforde.com/live

item.title: SHOW 107 - Richard Carr
item.itunes:title: SHOW 107 - Richard Carr
item.itunes:subtitle: Richard Carr is Senior Lecturer in History and Po…
item.description:
Richard Carr is Senior Lecturer in History and Politics at Anglia Ruskin University. He joins Matt to discuss his new book 'March of the Moderates', which studies The Third Way - a political creed championed by Bill Clinton's Democrats and Tony Blair's new Labour. As well as analysing the rise and fall of both, Matt picks Richard's brains about whether The Third Way could have a resurgence today. Get tickets for The Political Party and the London dates of 'Brexit, Pursued by a Bear': www.mattforde.com/live Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com Follow Richard on Twitter: @Richard_Carr Buy 'March of the Moderates' here: https://www.bloomsbury.com/uk/march-of-the-moderates-9781788317344/ Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

He joins Matt to discuss his new book 'March of the Moderates', which studies The Third Way - a political creed championed by Bill Clinton's Democrats and Tony Blair's new Labour. As well as analysing the rise and fall of both, Matt picks Richard's brains about whether The Third Way could have a resurgence today. Get tickets for The Political Party and the London dates of 'Brexit, Pursued by a Bear': www.mattforde.com/live Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com Follow Richard on Twitter: @Richard_Carr Buy 'March of the Moderates' here: https://www.bloomsbury.com/uk/march-of-the-moderates-9781788317344/ Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: SHOW 106 - Nicola Sturgeon (LIVE)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 106 - Nicola Sturgeon (LIVE)
item.itunes:subtitle: Nicola Sturgeon joins Matt at the Edinburgh Festi…
item.description:
Nicola Sturgeon joins Matt at the Edinburgh Festival for a wide-ranging and often hilarious interview. The First Minister reveals what really happened behind closed doors with Boris Johnson and her plan for dealing with him. They discuss the economic case for independence, the challenges and lessons of leadership and a love of books which leads to a question Nicola did not see coming... You can follow Nicola here: @NicolaSturgeon You can follow Matt here: @mattforde For tickets to the Political Party and other live dates go to: www.mattforde.com/live

item.title: SHOW 105 - Kezia Dugdale (LIVE)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 105 - Kezia Dugdale (LIVE)
item.itunes:subtitle: In the first of two specials recorded at the Edin…
item.description:
In the first of two specials recorded at the Edinburgh Festival, Matt is joined by Kezia Dugdale. Kezia is only 37 but has already been Deputy Leader and Leader of Scottish Labour. She led the party through one of the most tumultuous periods in its history, guiding it through the aftermath of the 2014 Scottish independence referendum. In this fascinating and frank interview, Kezia reveals the challenges she faced as leader and the work she now does in combating populism at the John Smith Centre. Follow Kezia here: @kezdugdale Read about the work of the John Smith Centre here: https://www.gla.ac.uk/schools/socialpolitical/johnsmith/ Follow Matt here: @mattforde For tickets to the Political Party and other live dates go to: www.mattforde.com/live

item.title: SHOW 104 - Deborah Mattinson
item.itunes:title: SHOW 104 - Deborah Mattinson
item.itunes:subtitle: Deborah Mattinson is a founding partner of resear…
item.description:
Deborah Mattinson is a founding partner of research company BritainThinks and advised the Labour Party from 1987 before becoming chief pollster to Gordon Brown. Deborah gives not just a fascinating snapshot of British public opinion now, but the benefit of years of analysis and research to tell us the changes in public opinion and our relationship with politicians. Deborah is the oracle of public opinion and shares her extensive experience and expertise, which makes for a thrilling listen. You can follow Deborah on Twitter here: @debmattinson You can follow BritainThinks here: @BritainThinks You can buy Deborah's book 'Talking to a Brick Wall' here: https://www.amazon.co.uk/Talking-Brick-Wall-listening-politics/dp/184954056X You can email the show here: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com You can follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde You can buy tickets to Matt's Edinburgh show 'Brexit, Pursued by a Bear here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/matt-forde-brexit-pursued-by-a-bear

item.title: SHOW 103 - Keir Starmer (LIVE)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 103 - Keir Starmer (LIVE)
item.itunes:subtitle: Keir Starmer is the Shadow Secretary of State for…
item.description:
Keir Starmer is the Shadow Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union and to many people, the real Leader of the Opposition. In this honest and sometimes hilarious interview, Keir takes us behind the scenes of the cross party Brexit talks, shadow cabinet meetings and his own discussions with Michel Barnier. He also reveals his frustrations with Brexit, his own party and British politics in general. Follow Keir on Twitter: @Keir_Starmer Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde Get tickets to Matt’s brand new Edinburgh show ‘Brexit Pursued by a Bear’ here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/matt-forde-brexit-pursued-by-a-bear

item.title: SHOW 102 - Tom Harris
item.itunes:title: SHOW 102 - Tom Harris
item.itunes:subtitle: Tom Harris was a Labour MP in Glasgow for 14 year…
item.description:
Tom Harris was a Labour MP in Glasgow for 14 years. In that time saw rapid change in the politics of Scotland, the Labour Party and the UK. Never one to pussyfoot around a subject, Tom delivers his unvarnished assessment of it all. Gloriously unpredictable, he doesn't always stand where you'd expect him to and in this straight-talking and hilarious interview, he calls it as he sees it. Buy Tom's book 'Ten Years in the Death of the Labour Party' here: https://www.amazon.co.uk/Ten-Years-Death-Labour-Party/dp/1785902237 Follow Tom on Twitter: @MrTCHarris Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde Buy tickets to Matt's brand-new, still-being-bloody-written-because-it's-always-kicking-off Edinburgh show 'Brexit, Pursued by a Bear' here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/matt-forde-brexit-pursued-by-a-bear

item.title: SHOW 99 - Sophie Walker
item.itunes:title: SHOW 99 - Sophie Walker
item.itunes:subtitle: Sophie Walker was the founding leader of the Wome…
item.description:
Sophie Walker was the founding leader of the Women's Equality Party and led the party for 4 years. In this powerful interview she reveals the lessons of leadership, the impact that the party has already had, the reason she stood down and what the future holds. Sophie also discusses the challenges facing women in politics and those that have personally effected herself as an individual. Oh and there's a discussion about Phillip Davies MP which might surprise you. You can follow Sophie on Twitter here: @SophieRunning You can get involved in Activate here: https://www.timetoactivate.org/ You can follow the Women's Equality Party here: @WEP_UK You can follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com See Matt's ever-extending 'Brexit Through The Gift Shop' tour on the following dates: 9 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED*** Salford Lowry 10 May: Aberystwyth Arts Centre 12 May: Edinburgh Stand 13 May: Glasgow Stand 14 May: Newcastle Stand 18 May: Chorley Little Theatre 24 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED *** Camberley Theatre 25 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED *** London Bloomsbury Theatre Tickets available at www.mattforde.com/live

item.itunes:title: SHOW 98 - Suella Braverman (Live)
item.itunes:subtitle: Suella Braverman has become one of the most promi…
item.description:
Suella Braverman has become one of the most prominent Brexiteers in Parliament. She is a leading member and former Chair of the European Research Group and dispels some of the myths surrounding it. As well as her frustrations with the government's handling of Brexit, Suella explains her journey towards voting Leave, why she believes Brexit is an opportunity for the UK and some top tips on how to make a great spaghetti bolognese. item.itunes:subtitle: Arthur Snell served in Iraq, Afghanistan, Yemen a…
item.description:
Arthur Snell served in Iraq, Afghanistan, Yemen and Zimbabwe as a diplomat and worked on the UK's anti-terrorism strategy 'Prevent'. In this revealing interview, Arthur gives a fascinating insight into the effects of Empire, Britain's role in the world and the dangers of working in some of the most volatile parts of the world. item.title: SHOW 97 - Christopher Hope
item.itunes:title: SHOW 97 - Christopher Hope
item.itunes:subtitle: Ten years ago the Expenses Scandal exposed the fi…
item.description:
Ten years ago the Expenses Scandal exposed the financial claims of our MPs and was an earthquake in UK politics. Christopher Hope helped break the story at the time and gives an insiders account of how The Daily Telegraph ran with it, his own unique role in the team and how it's changed our politics. He is also Chair of the Lobby and gives a peek into the world of political journalism including some potential help for Matt... You can follow Christopher Hope on Twitter here: @ChristopherHope You can subscribe to Chopper's Brexit Podcast here: https://podcasts.apple.com/gb/podcast/choppers-brexit-podcast/id1213415786 You can follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com See Matt's ever-extending 'Brexit Through The Gift Shop' tour on the following dates: 22 April: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED *** London Udderbelly Southbank 9 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED*** Salford Lowry 10 May: Aberystwyth Arts Centre 12 May: Edinburgh Stand 13 May: Glasgow Stand 14 May: Newcastle Stand 18 May: Chorley Little Theatre 24 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED *** Camberley Theatre 25 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED *** London Bloomsbury Theatre Tickets available at www.mattforde.com/live

item.title: SHOW 95 - George Osborne (Live)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 95 - George Osborne (Live)
item.itunes:subtitle: Well, the timing could not have been better. Geor…
item.description:
Well, the timing could not have been better. George Osborne joins Matt on the day that Theresa May announced that she would resign if her deal passed in the Commons and the night that the Commons held its indicative Brexit votes. George overcomes his grief at the Prime Minister's imminent departure and shares hilarious stories about working for Iain Duncan Smith, facing Gordon Brown for the first time and Russian spying. He also discusses his new role as editor of the Evening Standard, his opposition to the EU referendum and his time as Chancellor as well as, among other things, Love Island. You can follow George on Twitter here: @George_Osborne You can follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com See Matt's ever-extending 'Brexit Through The Gift Shop' tour on the following dates: 31 March: Bristol Hen and Chicken - SOLD OUT 5 April: Faversham No5 9 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED*** Salford Lowry 10 May: Aberystwyth Arts Centre 12 May: Edinburgh Stand 13 May: Glasgow Stand 14 May: Newcastle Stand 18 May: Chorley Little Theatre 25 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED *** Camberley Theatre Tickets available at www.mattforde.com/live

item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to this special, bonus live episode with …
item.description:
Welcome to this special, bonus live episode with 4 members of the newly formed Independent Group: Ann Coffey, Mike Gapes, Heidi Allen and Chuka Umunna. They all recently left the Labour and Conservative parties to sit together in the House of Commons. In these hilarious and at times emotional interviews, they reveal why they came to their individual decisions, what the future of the group is and what will set them apart from other political parties. Oh and what they had at Nando's. You can find out more about The Independent Group on their website: theindependent.group You can follow the group on Twitter here: @TheIndGroup You can follow Ann on Twitter here: @anncoffey_mp You can follow Mike on Twitter here: @MikeGapes You can follow Heidi on Twitter here: @heidiallen75 You can follow Chuka on Twitter here: @ChukaUmunna Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com Matt's 'Brexit Through The Gift Shop' tour continues nationwide and has added extra dates: 7 March: London - Southbank Centre 8 March: Stafford 12 March: London - Southbank Centre 14 March: Cambridge 15 March: Corby 19 March: London - The Other Palace 26 March: London - Leicester Square Theatre 31 March: Bristol 5 April: Faversham 9 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED*** Salford Lowry 10 May: Aberystwyth 12 May: Edinburgh Stand 13 May: Glasgow Stand 14 May: Newcastle Stand 18 May: Chorley 25 May: *** EXTRA DATE ADDED *** Camberley Theatre Tickets available at www.mattforde.com/live

item.title: SHOW 92 - Johnny Mercer
item.itunes:title: SHOW 92 - Johnny Mercer
item.itunes:subtitle: There aren't many politicians who've led a life l…
item.description:
There aren't many politicians who've led a life like Johnny Mercer. In this hilarious and sometimes emotional interview, Johnny tells Matt about his tours of Afghanistan and the effect they had on him, the way he thinks politics should be and his hopes for the future. Oh and some incredible stories you won't hear elsewhere. item.itunes:subtitle: Matt is joined by the Editor of Brexit Central, J…
item.description:
Matt is joined by the Editor of Brexit Central, Jonathan Isaby. The pair first met 12 years ago and here they rekindle their love of political impressions, election coverage and football stickers. Jonathan has been a prominent and influential writer and lobbyist, working for The Telegraph, ConservativeHome and running the Taxpayer's Alliance as their Chief Executive. item.itunes:title: SHOW 90 - Tony Blair
item.itunes:subtitle: Tony Blair joins Matt for a discussion about the …
item.description:
Tony Blair joins Matt for a discussion about the latest on Brexit. What happens with the backstop? Should we delay Article 50? Will he personally protest in the streets if he doesn't get his way? The former Prime Minister answers all those questions and more. item.title: SHOW 89 - David Blunkett (Live)
item.itunes:title: SHOW 89 - David Blunkett (Live)
item.itunes:subtitle: David Blunkett served as Education Secretary, Hom…
item.description:
David Blunkett served as Education Secretary, Home Secretary and Secretary of State for Work and Pensions under Tony Blair. One of the most talented and prominent members of the new Labour government, his achievements are even more remarkable given the challenges he had to overcome. David talks warmly and openly about politics then, politics now and how being blind at football matches is a lot better than it used to be. Oh and listen out for a timely intervention from his dog, Barley... Matt is now on tour with his show 'Brexit Through The Gift Shop' on the following dates: 1 Feb: Camberley 2 Feb: Gloucester 3 Feb: Salford 9 Feb: Maidstone 15 Feb: Leicester 18 Feb: Northallerton 19 Feb: Darlington 20 Feb: Barnard Castle 21 Feb: Hexham 7 March: London - Southbank Centre 8 March: Stafford 12 March: London - Southbank Centre 14 March: Cambridge 15 March: Corby 19 March: London - The Other Palace 26 March: London - Leicester Square Theatre 31 March: Bristol 5 April: Faversham 10 May: Aberystwyth 12 May: Edinburgh 13 May: Glasgow 14 May: Newcastle 18 May: Chorley Tickets available at www.mattforde.com/live

item.title: SHOW 88 - Sophie Jarvis
item.itunes:title: SHOW 88 - Sophie Jarvis
item.itunes:subtitle: Sophie Jarvis is Head of Public Affairs at the Ad…
item.description:
Sophie Jarvis is Head of Public Affairs at the Adam Smith Institute, a neoliberal think tank inspired by the great Scottish economist and philosopher. She joins Matt to discuss what makes the ASI different to other think tanks, showcases some of their more eye-catching policies and has a wider discussion about markets and the role of the state. Get tickets to Matt's 2019 tour here: www.mattforde.com/live Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde Follow Sophie on Twitter: @SophieJarvis94 Follow the ASI on Twitter: @ASI

item.title: SHOW 85 - PATRICK O'FLYNN
item.itunes:title: SHOW 85 - PATRICK O'FLYNN
item.itunes:subtitle: Patrick O'Flynn is an MEP for the East of England…
item.description:
Patrick O'Flynn is an MEP for the East of England and recently defected from UKIP to the SDP. Yes, the SDP are still going and they're Eurosceptic. Paddy takes us inside UKIP, his experience of being a 'centrist' member of it and shines a light on some of the disputes within the party in the last few years, including the final one with Gerrard Batten and why he could no longer stay in the party. He and Matt also discuss what a No Deal Brexit would mean. This one really could have lasted ten hours. Buy tickets for the Christmas specials here: https://leicestersquaretheatre.ticketsolve.com/shows/873589775 Buy tickets for Matt's tour here: www.mattforde.com/live Follow Paddy on Twitter here: @oflynnmep Follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Show 84 - PROF PHILIP COWLEY
item.itunes:title: Show 84 - PROF PHILIP COWLEY
item.itunes:subtitle: Prof Philip CowleyPhilip Cowley is Professor of…
item.description:
Prof Philip Cowley Philip Cowley is Professor of Politics at Queen Mary University of London. His latest book 'The British General Election of 2017' is widely regarded as the Bible of the last general election. He's an expert on Parliamentary voting and behaviour. In this light-hearted interview he explains what he loves and loathes about politics as well as giving a fascinating insight into the forces shaping politics. Buy tickets to the Political Party Christmas Specials here: https://leicestersquaretheatre.ticketsolve.com/shows/873589775 Order 'The British General Election of 2017' here: https://www.amazon.co.uk/British-General-Election-2017/dp/3319959352/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1544018588&sr=1-1&keywords=philip+cowley Follow Philip on Twitter: @philipjcowley Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde

item.itunes:title: Show 82 - KEVIN HAGUE
item.itunes:subtitle: Kevin Hague is an entrepreneur and founder of 'Th…
item.description:
Kevin Hague is an entrepreneur and founder of 'These Islands', a forum to promote unity between the people of the United Kingdom. In this fascinating interview he outlines his work trying to hold the SNP's Sustainable Growth Commission to account and the pros and cons of making a positive case for 'the Union'. item.title: Show 80 - Lord Andrew Cooper
item.itunes:title: Show 80 - Lord Andrew Cooper
item.itunes:subtitle: Lord Andrew CooperAndrew Cooper is the founder o…
item.description:
Lord Andrew Cooper Andrew Cooper is the founder of polling company Populus and was Director of Strategy to David Cameron in Downing Street. In this gripping interview, he explains how polling works, how the industry has changed, how mistakes happen and the social changes influencing our politics. He also discusses his own political beliefs and his time working in Number 10. item.title: Show 78 - JANE MERRICK
item.itunes:title: Show 78 - JANE MERRICK
item.itunes:subtitle: Jane MerrickJane was a Time Person of the Year i…
item.description:
Jane Merrick Jane was a Time Person of the Year in 2017 and has been at the heart of British political journalism for nearly 20 years. She joins Matt to discuss her career - including the differences between working for the Daily Mail and the Independent on Sunday - an her politics. Jane also talks about her experience of sexual harassment in Westminster, which led to Michael Fallon leaving the Cabinet. item.title: Show 74 - Tommy Sheridan (LIVE)
item.itunes:title: Show 74 - Tommy Sheridan (LIVE)
item.itunes:subtitle: Tommy SheridanTommy is one of Scotland's most ou…
item.description:
Tommy Sheridan Tommy is one of Scotland's most outspoken, controversial and passionate political voices. He rose to fame as a prominent campaigner against the Poll Tax and has led a colourful life which has seen him serve in the Scottish Parliament, live inside the Big Brother house and serve time in prison. He remains a passionate advocate for Scottish independence and socialism. He and Matt discuss the case for a second independence referendum, Jeremy Corbyn, phone hacking and how he survived on the inside.

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Show 73 - Andrew Mitchell (LIVE)
item.itunes:title: Show 73 - Andrew Mitchell (LIVE)
item.itunes:subtitle: Andrew Mitchell was Secretary of State for Intern…
item.description:
Andrew Mitchell was Secretary of State for International Development under David Cameron and one of John Major's whips during Maastricht. He gives a thrilling interview on life in government and politics, with hilarious tales about his life as a Whip, dealing with Boris Johnson and his surprising friendship with Jeremy Corbyn. Andrew gives a passionate defence of Britain's role in Development as well as an emotional insight into what it's like to be at the centre of political controversy. You can follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde You can buy tickets to Matt's new show 'Brexit Through The Gift Shop' at the Edinburgh Festival here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/matt-forde-brexit-through-the-gift-shop You can buy tickets to the 2 Political Party Specials at the Edinburgh Festival here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/matt-forde-s-political-party-podcast You can buy tickets to The Political Party Live here: https://theotherpalace.co.uk/whats-on/the-political-party-with-matt-forde/booking

item.title: Show 72 - Owen Jones
item.itunes:title: Show 72 - Owen Jones
item.itunes:subtitle: Owen Jones is a star in the world of political co…
item.description:
Owen Jones is a star in the world of political commentary. The most prominent Corbyn supporter in the British media he is also a highly successful author and shot to fame with his work 'Chavs: The Demonisation of the Working Class' which he followed up with 'The Establishment: And How They Get Away With It'. He joins Matt for a wildly meandering conversation about his own brand of left-wing politics, his Corbyn wobble, the personal cost of being a political activist, Alan Partridge and a whole load of other things. It's long but it flew by. You can follow Owen on Twitter here: @OwenJones84 You can buy Owen's books here: https://www.amazon.co.uk/Chavs-Demonization-Working-Owen-Jones/dp/1844678644 (not sure if he'd want you to buy them off Amazon) You can follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde You can buy tickets to Matt's brand new Edinburgh show 'Brexit Through The Gift Shop' here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/matt-forde-brexit-through-the-gift-shop and to his two Political Party specials in Edinburgh here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/matt-forde-s-political-party-podcast

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Show 71 - Jon Lansman (LIVE)
item.itunes:title: Show 71 - Jon Lansman (LIVE)
item.itunes:subtitle: Jon Lansman is the founder and creator of Momentu…
item.description:
Jon Lansman is the founder and creator of Momentum - the grassroots movement which helped propel Jeremy Corbyn to the Labour leadership and has transformed the Labour Party. Jon has been involved in left-wing activism his whole life and speaks movingly about his education, his relationship with Tony Benn and the reason his beard changed. It's an insight into the history of Corbynism and its roots in radical left-wing politics. You can follow Jon on Twitter @jonlansman You can follow Matt on Twitter @mattforde

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Show 70 - MATT ZARB-COUSIN
item.itunes:title: Show 70 - MATT ZARB-COUSIN
item.itunes:subtitle: Matt Zarb-Cousin was Jeremy Corbyn's spokesman an…
item.description:
Matt Zarb-Cousin was Jeremy Corbyn's spokesman and gives us a fascinating insight into working for him. He's still a strong advocate, not just for Corbyn as a person and politician, but for Corbyn's ideas. In this intriguing chat, Matt explains why Labour had to change and why he believes the party must become more democratic. He also talks frankly about his gambling addiction and his role in getting the government to limit maximum stakes on Fixed Odds Betting Terminals to £2. Oh and the two Matt's ponder a suggestion to make social media a bit friendlier... You can follow Matt Zarb-Cousin here: @mattzarb You can read about Matt's work for the Campaign For Fairer Gambling here: http://fairergambling.org/about-the-campaign/ You can follow Matt Forde here: @mattforde You can buy tickets to Matt Forde's tour and his new Edinburgh show 'Brexit Through The Gift Shop' here: www.mattforde.com/live

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Show 69 - Professor Angelia Wilson
item.itunes:title: Show 69 - Professor Angelia Wilson
item.itunes:subtitle: Professor Angelia WilsonProfessor Angelia Wilso…
item.description:
Professor Angelia Wilson Professor Angelia Wilson is Professor of Politics at the University of Manchester and Chair of the Political Studies Association. The daughter of a Texan preacher, she is an expert in the strategies of the Christian Right in America. In this thrilling interview, she discusses her own sexuality, her brilliant book 'Below the Belt' and imparts just some of her vast knowledge. Oh and Matt almost ties himself in knots trying to find the right words for things... You can follow Ange on Twitter here:@AngeliaWilson89 You can follow The Political Party on Instagram here: @politicalpartypodcast You can follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde You can buy 'Below the Belt' here: https://www.bloomsbury.com/uk/below-the-belt-9780304335503/ You can read Ange's fascinating interview with THE here: https://www.timeshighereducation.com/features/left-needs-to-listen-better-and-learn-little-bit-of-political-strategy-from-right You can follow Ange's academic work here: https://www.research.manchester.ac.uk/portal/angelia.r.wilson.html

item.title: Show 68 - Professor Anand Menon
item.itunes:title: Show 68 - Professor Anand Menon
item.itunes:subtitle: Professor Anand Menon Forget every other discus…
item.description:
Professor Anand Menon Forget every other discussion you've heard about Brexit because Professor Anand Menon is going to explain it all. In this engrossing dissection of modern British politics, the professor of European Politics and Foreign Affairs at Kings College doesn't just put the debate into a fascinating context, he also delivers various bolts of positivity and some brilliant facts. Just when you thought you were fed up of Brexit, Anand will reawaken the excitement of it all. Vote for the Political Party here: https://www.britishpodcastawards.com/vote You can follow Anand here: @anandMenon1 You can follow Matt here: @mattforde Buy Anand's latest book here: https://www.amazon.co.uk/Brexit-British-Politics-Geoffrey-Evans/dp/1509523863/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1525266370&sr=1-1&keywords=anand+menon That discussion on the Bank of England and Spotify... http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-43960998 'Listen, Liberal' book available here: http://listenliberal.com

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Show 66 - Professor Rosie Campbell
item.itunes:title: Show 66 - Professor Rosie Campbell
item.itunes:subtitle: Professor Rosie Campbell is Professor of Politics…
item.description:
Professor Rosie Campbell is Professor of Politics at Birkbeck University and specialises in voting behaviour. In this rickshaw ride through the psychology of voting, Rosie and Matt explore the appeal of local candidates, the Derren Brown-style techniques used in Rosie's latest research, a fascinating concept of 'Motivated Cognition' which could determine your opinion of a cat, plus loads more including a discovery of how sad they are which leads to a suggestion for possibly the best day trip ever. Oh and there's a revelation about halfway through about the studio which may not surprise you. You can vote for The Political Party in the British Podcast Awards here: https://www.britishpodcastawards.com/vote You can follow Rosie here: @ProfRosieCamp You can hear Rosie's Radio 4 series 'How Voters Decide' here: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b08ff18d You can access Rosie's research here: http://www.bbk.ac.uk/politics/our-staff/academic/rosie-campbell/index_html You can follow Matt here: @mattforde

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Show 65 - Professor Sarah Childs
item.itunes:title: Show 65 - Professor Sarah Childs
item.itunes:subtitle: Professor Sarah ChildsProfessor Childs is Profe…
item.description:
Professor Sarah Childs Professor Childs is Professor of Politics and Gender and Director of the Centre for the Study of British Politics and Public Life at Birkbeck University. In this fascinating interview, Sarah and Matt discuss the 8 key questions of representation theory and explore the issues facing women in politics. Sarah also discusses her role advising various Parliamentary bodies on improving representation. It's an engrossing analysis of what progress has been made, what more needs to be done and how it can be achieved. You can follow Sarah on Twitter here: @profsarahchilds You can follow Matt on Twitter here: @mattforde You can read Sarah's 'The Good Parliament' report here: http://www.bristol.ac.uk/media-library/sites/news/2016/july/20%20Jul%20Prof%20Sarah%20Childs%20The%20Good%20Parliament%20report.pdf Sarah's essay in the Political Representation Handbook is here: http://www.bbk.ac.uk/politics/our-staff/academic/joni-lovenduski/PoliticalRepresentation.pdf

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.

item.title: Show 64 - Chris Coghlan
item.itunes:title: Show 64 - Chris Coghlan
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris CoghlanChris recently took the unusual st…
item.description:
Chris Coghlan Chris recently took the unusual step of setting up a new political party. They're called 'Renew' and are a centrist, pro-European party, but will they be able to gain a foothold in British politics? Chris explains what setting up a new party involves, how policy is made, what their aims and ambitions for the future are and where his driving force comes from. It's a fascinating insight into how to create a political movement. You can follow Chris here: @_chris_coghlan You can follow Renew here: @Renew_Britain You can follow Matt here: @mattforde And you can buy tickets to Matt's live shows and the tour that he won't shut up about here: www.mattforde.com/live

item.description:
In a Political Party first, Matt is joined by an academic, Prof Roger Scully. Roger is Professor of Political Science at Cardiff University and author of 'The End of British Party Politics' which is out in April 2018. As well as exploring the competing political forces in each of the nations of the UK, Matt tries to get Roger to predict the future... item.itunes:summary:
In a Political Party first, Matt is joined by an academic, Prof Roger Scully. Roger is Professor of Political Science at Cardiff University and author of 'The End of British Party Politics' which is out in April 2018. As well as exploring the competing political forces in each of the nations of the UK, Matt tries to get Roger to predict the future... Follow Roger here: @roger_scully Follow Matt here: @mattforde Get tickets for all of Matt's tour dates: www.mattforde.com/live Order Roger's book 'The End of British Party Politics' here: https://www.bitebackpublishing.com/books/the-end-of-british-party-politics

item.title: Show 59 - Lord Daniel Finkelstein
item.itunes:title: Show 59 - Lord Daniel Finkelstein
item.itunes:subtitle: Lord Daniel Finkelstein has advised more Conserva…
item.description:
Lord Daniel Finkelstein has advised more Conservative leaders than almost anyone else in recent history and gives Matt an illuminating peek behind the curtain of the leaderships of John Major, William Hague, David Cameron and Theresa May. He also gives some tips on how to get the most of your time in the House of Lords - should you ever be enobled - and gives his unique perspective on the Jeremy Corbyn Czech spy story. An hour just wasn't enough... Email the show: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com Follow Daniel on Twitter: @dannythefink Follow Matt on Twitter: @mattforde Get tickets to see Matt's brand new tour here: www.mattforde.com/live

item.itunes:subtitle: Paul Staines aka Guido Fawkes gives Matt a rare i…
item.description:
Paul Staines aka Guido Fawkes gives Matt a rare interview and takes us behind the scenes at Britain's most successful political blog site. item.itunes:subtitle: Owen Bennett, Deputy Political Editor of Huffingt…
item.description:
Owen Bennett, Deputy Political Editor of Huffington Post, gives us a first on the Political Party: a journalists perspective on politics. item.title: Show 54 - Theo Bertram
item.itunes:title: Show 54 - Theo Bertram
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to the new Political Party weekly. In the…
item.description:
Welcome to the new Political Party weekly. In the first episode of this bold new era Matt is joined by Theo Bertram who worked as a Special Adviser to both Tony Blair and Gordon Brown in Downing Street. Theo shares some brilliant inside stories that you won't hear anywhere else about working at the very top of UK politics, including going 'undercover' to record George Osborne... which doesn't exactly go to plan. Email the show with any questions, reactions or thoughts: politicalpartypodcast@gmail.com You can follow Matt on Twitter @mattforde You can follow Theo on Twitter @theobertram

item.itunes:subtitle: For the second show Matt is joined by the UKIP le…
item.description:
For the second show Matt is joined by the UKIP leader Nigel Farage to discuss Europe, immigration, gay marriage and the environment. Recorded live at the St James Theatre. For info and tickets to future shows visit http://www.stjamestheatre.co.uk

Hosted on Acast. See acast.com/privacy for more information.
